channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report X-2024050354
item.description:
Report X-2024050354

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-10T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-07
  • City: TOLEDO
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW DUE TO EXTERNAL CARTON WET PACKAGE FOUND ON TRAILER #820519 ALREADY DAMAGED WET UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS 1 X 3.79L METAL CAN OF MAVCOAT 527 ML THE ONE METAL CAN OF MAVCOAT 527 ML WAS BENT DENTED WITH A LOOSE CAP ALLOWING 1L TO RELEASE NO SLOTTED PARTITIONS BAGS OR ABSORBENT WAS FOUND. FACILITY PROCEDUES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIALS FOLLOWED CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report E-2024050128
item.description:
Report E-2024050128

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-10T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-26
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 26, 2024, three (3) 50-pound bags of Quick Cure 275 arrived forked and released approximately one (1) pound of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel placed the damaged bags in one (1) drum liner, then utilized a vacuum unit to remediate the site. All debris was collected in one (1) separate drum liner. Finally, the crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to finish the remediation. All spent absorbents were containerized in one (1) additional drum liners. The three (3) drum liners were placed in one (1) 95-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050030
item.description:
Report E-2024050030

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-07T15:13:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-02
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from five (5) 1-gallon metal pails due to falling freight. The terminal personnel deployed granular absorbents and cleaned up the released material. The recovered material was containerized into two (2) 5-gallon metal pails. The generated waste was staged onsite in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.description:

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from nine (9) 1-gallon metal pails. The released material impacted the trailer floor and cardboard packaging. Dayton Freight cleaned the released material and placed the damaged 1-gallon pails into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 25, 2024, one (1) 50-pound bag of UN1487 was torn due to a load shift and released approximately two (2) pounds of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from TLE personnel utilized a HEPA filtered drum vacuum to remove any free-standing product from the impacted area. All undamaged cargo was wiped with absorbent pads to remove any residual product and repalletized for continued processing and shipping. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 15-gallon drum for disposal purposes.

item.title: Report E-2024050013
item.description:
Report E-2024050013

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-22
  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 22, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum containing UN1992 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents and a neutralizing agent to remediate the UN1992-impacted loading dock floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 85-gallon overpack and staged on site for transport and disposal.
